title: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp hit with selection dilemma for Merseyside derby with 12 players away on international duty
text:

Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp faces an anxious wait over the international break as 12 first-team members are away on international duty. 
Brazilian stars Philippe Coutinho and Roberto Firmino could be hit most by fatigue with two World Cup qualifiers in South America. 
Selecao boss Tite is preparing for crunch games against Uruguay in Montevideo on Thursday before hosting Paraguay in Sao Paulo - set for the early hours of Wednesday March 29 UK time. 
The pair will then have to endure a 6,000-mile journey back to Merseyside, arriving at Melwood just two days before the Everton clash, report the Liverpool Echo. Jurgen Klopp will be praying his players return fresh for the derby (Photo: Laurence Griffiths/Getty Images) Liverpool legend John Aldridge highlights the key position that boss Jurgen Klopp MUST sign this summer 
Liverpool’s England contingent has been depleted by injuries to Jordan Henderson and Daniel Sturridge. However, Adam Lallana and Nathaniel Clyne are in Gareth Southgate’s squad for Wednesday’s friendly away to Germany and the World Cup qualifier at home to Lithuania on Sunday. 
Joe Gomez is with England Under-21s for their friendlies away to Germany and Denmark, while Trent Alexander-Arnold is with England Under-19s for their elite round qualifiers against Norway, Spain and Belarus. 
Simon Mignolet and Divock Origi have gone away with Belgium for their World Cup qualifier at home to Greece on Saturday which is followed by a friendly against Russia in Sochi three days later. Ragnar Klavan will be skippering Estonia in their qualifier in Cyprus on Saturday with the Liverpool centre-back also likely to feature in a friendly at home to Croatia next Tuesday. 
Klopp won’t have to worry about Sadio Mane’s travel plans during this international break. Senegal face Nigeria at Barnet FC on Thursday before taking on the Ivory Coast in Paris on Monday. 
Reds midfielders Gini Wijnaldum and Emre Can, who both performed so well in Sunday’s 1-1 draw with Manchester City, have also flown off. Adam Lallana will be away with England in Germany (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Read More Liverpool transfer news and rumours: Reds to battle Everton for £20million Michael Keane? 
Wijnaldum is with the Netherlands squad for a World Cup qualifier against Bulgaria in Sofia on March 25 and a friendly against Italy three days later. 
Can has been called up by Germany coach Joachim Loew for their friendly with England at Borussia Dortmund’s Westfalenstadion on Wednesday night. Can then faces a trip to Azerbaijan for a World Cup qualifier in Baku on March 26.
